title: Ukraine crisis: Obama says US 'not taking military action' â as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: obama : 'we are not taking military action ' in ukraine .
obama : russian presence in ukraine 'plain for world to see '
russian envoy : 'everybody knows ' russians in ukraine .
un security council holds emergency meeting .

text: russian president vladimir putin called on pro-russian rebels to provide a humanitarian corridor in east ukraine for encircled ukrainian government troops to leave the battlefield , the kremlin said in a statement on friday , according to reuters : i call on the militia forces to open a humanitarian corridor for encircled ukraine servicemen in order to avoid pointless victims , to allow them leave the fighting area without impediment , join their families , to provide urgent medical aid to those wounded as a result of the military operation , he said in a statement .

putin also said russia will continue to provide humanitarian aid to civilians in east ukraine , less than a week after russia 's first aid convoy delivered supplies to east ukraine and then returned to russia .
we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the day .
here 's a summary of where things stand : president obama ruled out us military action in ukraine , even as he said the russian military incursion there was plain for the world to see .
obama said he would visit estonia next week and that the us would honor its pact to defend all nato members .
nato estimated that there are now more than 1,000 russian soldiers fighting in ukraine and released satellite imagery it said showed russian armour .
the us state department said it 's clear russian forces have intervened directly .
the un secretary-general called it a disastrous escalation .
everybody knows that there are russian volunteers in eastern ukraine , said vitaly churkin , the russian ambassador to the un , at an emergency meeting of the security council to discuss the crisis .
nobody is hiding that .
he blamed the crisis on ukrainian military escalation .
us ambassador to the un samantha power said the situation in eastern ukraine was a replay of russia 's illegal annexation of crimea .
obama declined to call the russian incursion in ukraine an invasion .
i consider the actions that we 've seen last week a continuation of what 's been taking place for months now , he said .
obama said sanctions were working to weaken russia and that additional steps would be discussed at the nato summit next week .
separately , german chancellor angela merkel also spoke of additional sanctions .
ukrainian president petro poroshenko will visit the white house next month , obama said .
at the un meeting , ambassador power said russia has manipulated .
it has obfuscated .
it has outright lied about its role in ukraine , reminding the council that the meeting was the 24th session to try to rein in russia 's aggressive acts in the ukraine .
the ap reports : every single one has sent a straightforward , unified message : russia , stop this conflict .
russia is not listening , ' she said , adding that russia 's force along the border is the largest it 's been since it started deploying there in late may .
russian ambassador vitaly churkin offered a spirited defense , saying kiev is waging war against its own people .

the us ambassador to the un up on the russian ambassador 's line about everybody knowing that russian volunteers are in ukraine : samantha power ( @ ambassadorpower ) russian amb : `` everyone knows russian volunteers are fighting in ukraine '' 1st such admission ?
like crimea : take territory 1st , admit it later
a state department official highlights the president 's line that russia is hurting russia .
rick stengel ( @ stengel ) .
@ barackobama : it is russian decision-making that is isolating russia .
rick stengel ( @ stengel ) .
@ barackobama `` this ongoing russian incursion into ukraine will only bring more costs and consequences for russia . ''
the president ends his news conference after just more than a half hour .

documents.title: obama : 'we are not taking military action ' in ukraine
text: obama is asked about resorting to force in ukraine .
he categorically rejects the possibility : we are not taking military action to solve the ukrainian problem .
what we are doing is to mobilize the international community to apply pressure i think it is very important to recognize that a military solution to this problem is not going to be forthcoming .
he goes on to say that russia has been weakened by the ukraine episode .

it is not in the cards for us to see a military confrontation between russia and the united states in this region that said , obama says , he 's about to attend a nato conference , and will visit estonia .
we take our article 5 commitments to defend each other very seriously , and that includes small countries , he says .
he mentions that ukraine is not part of nato .
us president barack obama speaks in the white house briefing room on august 28 , 2014 , in washington , dc .
ngan/afp/getty images alyssa milano ( @ alyssa milano ) our president is speaking about critically important issues & all people talk about is his # tansuit ? ?
c'mon people !
we are better than that .
on to ukraine : was today 's escalation an invasion ?
i consider the actions that we 've seen last week a continuation of what 's been taking place for months now this is not a homegrown indigenous uprising in easern ukraine .
the separatists are backed , trained , armed , financed by russia we 've seen deep russian involvement in everything they 've done .
russia determined that they had to be a little more overt but it 's not really a shift .
he says putin has passed by potential off ramps .
we have not seen any meaningful action on the part of russia to actually try to resolve this in a diplomatic fashion .
question for obama : do you need congress ' approval to go into syria ?

i have consulted with congress i am confident that as commander-in-chief i have the authority to engage in the acts that we are conducting currently [ moving forward ] it will be important for congress to weigh in .
i will consult with congress and make sure their voices are heard .
the first question for obama is not about ukraine but about iraq and the islamic state / isis /isil threat .
the president had said that the us is reviewing its options for confronting the group in iraq and syria .
he calls for the advent of an inclusive government in iraq : isil has come to represent the very worst elements in the region that we have to deal with collectively .
and that 's gon na be a long-term project .
obama says he will welcome poroshenko to the white house next month to confirm america 's unwavering commitment to ukraine .
he says the us and allies will discuss additional steps at the nato summit next week .

documents.title: obama : russian presence in ukraine 'plain for world to see '
text: obama says he has long said russia was responsible for the violence in eastern ukraine and the new images of russian forces inside ukraine make that plain for the world to see .
he says he has just spoken with german chancellor angela merkel .
president obama is scheduled to speak soon at the white house .
you can watch on the white house web site here .
a flag of the self-proclaimed donetsk people 's republic is seen at the top of damaged war memorial at savur-mohyla , a hill east of the city of donetsk , august 28 , 2014 .
shemetov/reuters

guardian europe editor ian traynor continues his conversation with diplomats a week before the 4-5 september nato summit : ian traynor ( @ traynorbrussels ) # ukraine extraordinary how top # nato # eu types almost bragging that they do n't have the answers to putin ian traynor ( @ traynorbrussels ) # ukraine striking how top # nato # eu types admit putin winning/won the propaganda war # defeatism

the meeting of obama 's national security council has been bumped to after the president 's white house statement , the press secretary explains : josh earnest ( @ presssec ) still on , just slightly delayed mt @ twitterid so when 's the nsc meeting ?

ian traynor , the guardian 's europe editor , quotes diplomats in the run-up to the 4-5 september nato summit as saying that nato forces in the east are readily deployable if needed : ian traynor ( @ traynorbrussels ) # natosummitwales # easternbases brigade-strength alliance forces deployed within 5 days if needed - dip sources

documents.title: obama to make statement
text: president obama will make a statement on the ukraine crisis at 4pm , the white house has announced .
ukrainian deputy ambassador oleksandr pavlichenko replies to churkin , saying that his side is willing to discuss anything except the integrity of ukrainian borders , which are non-negotiable .

euromaidan pr ( @ euromaidanpr ) # ukraine rep at # unsc : we call on # russia to recall its troops from ukraine to save lives of ukrainians , russians |empr the security council meeting is adjourned .
churkin resumes speaking .
he challenges the ukrainian narrative of what happened to malaysia airlines flight 17 , shot down over donetsk on 17 july .
he says ukrainian officials have refused to release data in the case .
moscow has been blamed for providing ukrainian rebels with the surface-to-air missile system that downed the plane , killing 283 passengers and 15 crew .

the russia mission to nato is in a twitter war with the canadian delegation , which yesterday sent a tongue-in-cheek tweet with a map of the ukrainian-russian border , as a guide for russian soldiers who keep getting lost & accidentally ' entering ukraine .
but the map showed crimea as belonging to ukraine .
not so , says russia : russians at nato ( @ natomission ru ) helping our canadian colleagues to catch up with contemporary geography of # europe @ twitterid

documents.title: russian envoy : 'everybody knows ' russians in ukraine
text: churkin continues : everybody knows that there are russian volunteers in eastern ukraine .
nobody is hiding that .
he says russia has been transparent , unlike the united states .
what about the tens of american advisers in the kiev security offices ?
[ ] he says .
stop interfering in the internal affairs of sovereign states !
vitaly churkin , the russian federation ambassador to the un , is speaking at the emergency security council meeting .
he says that tensions in ukraine stem from what he calls kiev 's war on its own people .
he demands that ukrainian president poroshenko produce details of a peace plan he mentioned after a meeting tuesday with russian president putin .
churkin says poroshenko 's talk of a peace plan is a distraction from ukrainian military operations .

an emergency meeting of the the organisation for security and co-operation in europe ( osce ) was also due to take place on thursday ahead of separate talks planned on ukraine at next week 's nato summit in wales and a un general assembly meeting chaired by barack obama in new york in early september , reports guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) : but the rapid escalation of russian attacks in ukraine has put the white house under mounting pressure to respond sooner to both threats .

in a briefing with reporters , state department spokeswoman jen psaki said the us had a range of tools and sanctions at its disposal to put pressure on russian leader vladimir putin , and hinted that there was a live debate in the administration about speeding up its response .
obviously discussions are ongoing about what additional steps may need to take place , she said .
i do n't want to make predictions about a decision that not yet been made .
[ ] we will not hold back in putting in place punitive measures that we do think will have an impact over the long term .
psaki also confirmed earlier nato reports that the it was now clear that russian forces were intervening directly against ukrainian troops .

the us mission to the united nations ( @ usun ) has tweeted key lines from samantha power 's speech : representatives on this council , this is our 24th session to try to rein in russia 's outrageous actions in ukraine .
every single one of those sessions has sent a straight-forward , unified message : russia , stop this conflict .
russia has come before unsc to say everything except truth .
it has manipulated .
it has obfuscated .
it has outright lied .
we have learned to measure russia by its actions , not its words .
in last 48 hours , # russia 's actions have spoken volumes .
russian deployments into ukraine include advanced artillery and air defense systems not found in the ukrainian inventory .
one of the separatist leaders # russia has armed and backed said three or four thousand russians have joined their cause .
us mission to the un ( @ usun ) .
@ ambassadorpower : `` a russian soldier who chooses to fight in # ukraine on his summer break is still a russian soldier . ''
how can we tell countries bordering russia their sovereignty is guaranteed if we do n't make our message heard on ukraine ?
the un security council meeting can be viewed on the un web site here .
in the face of this threat , the cost of inaction is unacceptable , power says .
us ambassador to the un samantha power has pointed words for moscow : russia has to stop lying , and has to stop fueling this conflict , she says .
the mask is coming off .

president barack obama will meet with security advisers at 4pm et to discuss the situation in ukraine , guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts reports : dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) obama has called a meeting with his security advisers in the situation room at 4pm .
i imagine to discuss ukraine invasion .

the state department says it 's clear that russian forces are fighting in ukraine : dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) us state dept @ twitterid says `` it is clear '' russian forces have `` intervened directly and are fighting directly with ukrainians ''

alec luhn ( @ asluhn ) reports for the guardian on a small antiwar protest outside the kremlin : alec luhn ( @ asluhn ) as becomes clear regular russian soldiers are in # ukraine , few dozen anti-war protestors at kremlin .
@ twitterid

documents.title: un security council holds emergency meeting
text: welcome to our live blog coverage as the united nations security council holds an emergency meeting to discuss the russian invasion of ukraine .
russia denies any of its troops are in eastern ukraine .
but on thursday , nato said it estimated that there were now more than 1,000 russian soldiers fighting there .
the organisation released satellite imagery it said showed that russian armoured vehicles and artillery have been crossing into ukraine for at least a week .

guardian moscow correspondent shaun walker ( @ shaunwalker7 ) reports : the ukrainian president , petro poroshenko , said russian forces have actually entered ukraine , while ukrainian fighters in the southeast said russian forces had helped separatists take over the border town of novoazovsk .
western leaders swiftly seized on the latest escalation by warning russian president vladimir putin of imminent consequences .

angela merkel , the german chancellor , said the eu would discuss further sanctions at a summit this weekend , particularly in light of the fresh incursion in which russia stands accused of funnelling troops and hardware into the southeast of ukraine .
we are getting reports of an increased presence of russian soldiers and of new unrest and fresh advances of the separatists in areas that until now were very quiet , she said .
we made it clear in march this year that if there was a further escalation , more sanctions would have to be discussed .
ukrainian prime minister arseny yatsenyuk called for the emergency security council meeting and asked the eu and us to freeze russian assets .

a video of the appeal was uploaded to youtube thursday : ukrainian pm yatsenyuk calls for emergency un meeting ukrainian president petro poroshenko , meanwhile , has appealed for nato protection : ððµññð¾ ðð¾ñð¾ñðµð½ðºð¾ ( @ poroshenko ) we called for the us to designate ukraine a major non-nato ally .
stay with us for updates in this developing story .
